an3.125:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī, at the Gotamaka Tree-shrine.
an3.125:1.2: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants,
an3.125:2.1: “Mendicants, I teach based on direct knowledge, not without direct knowledge.
an3.125:2.2: I teach with reasons, not without them.
an3.125:2.3: I teach with a demonstrable basis, not without it.
an3.125:2.4: Since this is so, you should follow my advice and instruction.
an3.125:2.5: This is enough for you to feel joyful, delighted, and happy:
an3.125:2.6: ‘The Blessed One is a fully awakened Buddha! The teaching is well explained! The Saṅgha is practicing well!’”
an3.125:3.1: That is what the Buddha said.
an3.125:3.2: Satisfied, the mendicants were happy with what the Buddha said.
an3.125:3.3: And while this discourse was being spoken, the galaxy shook.
